[The girls]225-the girls watched [them]228-the boys out of sight , standing close beside [Aslan]95-aslan . The light was changing . Low down in the east , [Aravir]168-aravir , [the morning star of [Narnia]1-narnia]1070-the morning star of narnia , gleamed like a little moon . [Aslan]95-aslan , who seemed larger than before , lifted [his]95-aslan head , shook [his]95-aslan mane and roared .

The sound , deep and throbbing at first like an organ beginning on a low note , rose and became louder , and then far louder again , till the earth and air were shaking with it . It rose up from [that hill]2122-that hill and floated across all [Narnia]1-narnia . Down in [[Miraz]92-miraz 's [camp]2108-camp]1072-miraz 's camp [men]1691-men woke , stared palely in [one another]780-one another 's faces , and grasped [their]1691-men weapons . Beyond [it]17-the great river , in [every field]1078-every field and wood , the alert ears of rabbits rose from [their]1079-their holes , the sleepy heads of birds came out from under wings , owls hooted , vixens barked , hedgehogs grunted , the trees stirred . In [towns]1080-towns and [villages]1081-villages [mothers]1082-mothers pressed [babies]1608-babies close to [their]1082-mothers breasts , staring with wild eyes , dogs whimpered , and [men]1691-men leaped up groping for lights . Far away on the northern frontier the mountain giants peered from the dark gateways of [[their]1691-men castles]1085-their castles .

What [Lucy]72-lucy and [Susan]70-susan saw was a dark something coming to [them]1086-they from almost every direction across [the hills]1087-the hills . It looked first like a black mist creeping on the ground , then like the stormy waves of a black sea rising higher and higher as it came on , and then , at last , like what it was â€” woods on the move . All the trees of [the world]1697-the world appeared to be rushing towards [Aslan]95-aslan . But as [they]1086-they drew nearer [they]1086-they looked less like trees , and when [the whole crowd , bowing and curtsying and waving thin long arms]1089-the whole crowd , bowing and curtsying and waving thin long arms to [Aslan]95-aslan , were all around [Lucy]72-lucy , [she]72-lucy saw that it was [a crowd of human shapes]1090-a crowd of human shapes . "[1086-they] in [their]1086-they various husky or creaking or wave - like voices .

[The crowd]1096-the crowd and the dance round [Aslan]95-aslan ( for it had become a dance once more ) grew so thick and rapid that [Lucy]72-lucy was confused . [She]72-lucy never saw where [certain other people]1097-certain other people came from who were soon capering about among the trees . [One]311-one was [a youth , dressed only in a fawn - skin , with vine - leaves wreathed in [his]311-one curly hair]1099-a youth , dressed only in a fawn - skin , with vine - leaves wreathed in his curly hair . " Is it a Romp , [Aslan]95-aslan ? "[1110-the youth] cried [the youth]1110-the youth . And apparently it was . But nearly [everyone]230-everyone seemed to have a different idea as to what [they]230-everyone were playing . It may have been Tig , but [Lucy]72-lucy never discovered who was [It]1112-it . It was rather like [Blind Man]117-man 's Buff , only [everyone]230-everyone behaved as if [they]230-everyone were blindfolded . It was not unlike [Hunt the Slipper]172-hunt the slipper , but the slipper was never found . What made it more complicated was that [the man on the donkey , who was old and enormously fat]1114-the man on the donkey , who was old and enormously fat , began calling out at once , " Refreshments ! Time for refreshments , "[311-one] and falling off [his]311-one donkey and being bundled on to it again by [the others]271-the others , while [the donkey]1116-the donkey was under the impression that the whole thing was a circus , and tried to give a display of walking on its hind legs . And all the time there were more and more vine leaves everywhere . And soon not only leaves but vines . [They]230-everyone were climbing up everything . [They]230-everyone were running up the legs of [the tree people]1117-the tree people and circling round [their]230-everyone necks . After that it was mostly grapes â€” overhead and underfoot and all around .

" Refreshments ! Refreshments , "[520-the old man] roared [the old man]520-the old man . [Everyone]230-everyone began eating , and whatever hothouses [[your]1121-your people]1122-your people may have , [you]1121-your have never tasted such grapes . Really good grapes , firm and tight on the outside , but bursting into cool sweetness when [you]1121-your put them into [your]1121-your mouth , were one of the things [the girls]225-the girls had never had quite enough of before . Here , there were more than [anyone]217-anyone could possibly want , and no table - manners at all . [One]311-one saw sticky and stained fingers everywhere , and , though mouths were full , the laughter never ceased nor the yodelling cries of [Euan]171-euan , [euan]1126-euan , eu - oi - oi - oi - oi , till all of a sudden [everyone]230-everyone felt at the same moment that the game ( whatever it was ) , and the feast , ought to be over , and [everyone]230-everyone flopped down breathless on the ground and turned [their]230-everyone faces to [Aslan]95-aslan to hear what [he]95-aslan would say next .

At that moment the sun was just rising and [Lucy]72-lucy remembered something and whispered to [Susan]70-susan ,

The next minute or so was very confused . " Now , [Lucy]72-lucy , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan .

[Reepicheep]135-reepicheep became aware of [his]135-reepicheep loss as [he]135-reepicheep made [his]135-reepicheep bow ; perhaps it altered something in [his]135-reepicheep balance . [He]135-reepicheep looked over [his]135-reepicheep right shoulder . Failing to see [his]135-reepicheep tail , [he]135-reepicheep strained [his]135-reepicheep neck further till [he]135-reepicheep had to turn [his]135-reepicheep shoulders and [his]135-reepicheep whole body followed . But by that time [his]135-reepicheep hind quarters had turned too and were out of sight . Then [he]135-reepicheep strained [his]135-reepicheep neck looking over [his]135-reepicheep shoulder again , with the same result . Only after [he]135-reepicheep had turned completely round three times did [he]135-reepicheep realise the dreadful truth .

" [I]135-reepicheep am confounded , "[135-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]135-reepicheep to [Aslan]95-aslan . " [I]135-reepicheep am completely out of countenance . [I]135-reepicheep must crave [your]95-aslan indulgence for appearing in this unseemly fashion . "[135-reepicheep]

" It becomes [you]135-reepicheep very well , [Small One]198-small one , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan .

" All the same , "[135-reepicheep] replied [Reepicheep]135-reepicheep , " if anything could be done ... Perhaps [[her]72-lucy Majesty]2133-her majesty ? "[135-reepicheep] and here [he]135-reepicheep bowed to [Lucy]72-lucy .

" But what do [you]135-reepicheep want with a tail ? "[95-aslan] asked [Aslan]95-aslan .

" [Sir]2524-sir , "[197-the master mouse] said [the Mouse]197-the master mouse , " [I]197-the master mouse can eat and sleep and die for [[my]197-the master mouse King]1872-my king without one . But a tail is the honour and glory of [a Mouse]197-the master mouse . "[197-the master mouse]

" [I]95-aslan have sometimes wondered , [friend]1815-friend , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan , " whether [you]1815-friend do not think too much about [your]1815-friend honour . "[95-aslan]

" Highest of [all High Kings]2541-all high kings , "[135-reepicheep] said [Reepicheep]135-reepicheep , " permit [me]135-reepicheep to remind [you]135-reepicheep that a very small size has been bestowed on [[us]2542-our [Mice]151-the mice]2543-us mice , and if [we]2542-our did not guard [our]2542-our dignity , [some ( who weigh worth by inches]2544-some ( who weigh worth by inches ) would allow [themselves]2544-some ( who weigh worth by inches very unsuitable pleasantries at [our]2542-our expense . "[135-reepicheep] Here [he]135-reepicheep glared very fiercely up at [Wimbleweather]149-giant wimbleweather , but the Giant , who was always a stage behind [everyone else]247-everyone else , had not yet discovered what was being talked about down at [his]135-reepicheep feet , and so missed the point .

" Why have [[your]2524-sir followers]2548-your followers all drawn [their]2548-your followers swords , may [I]95-aslan ask ? "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan .

" Ah ! "[95-aslan] roared [Aslan]95-aslan . " [You]2524-sir have conquered [me]95-aslan . [You]2524-sir have great hearts . Not for the sake of [your]2524-sir dignity , [Reepicheep]135-reepicheep , but for the love that is between [you]2524-sir and [[your]2524-sir people]1122-your people , and still more for the kindness [[your]2524-sir people]1122-your people showed [me]95-aslan long ago when [you]2524-sir ate away the cords that bound [me]95-aslan on the Stone Table ( and it was then , though [you]2524-sir have long forgotten it , that [you]2524-sir began to be [Talking Mice]151-the mice ) , [you]2524-sir shall have [your]2524-sir tail again . "[95-aslan]

Before [Aslan]95-aslan had finished speaking the new tail was in its place . Then , at [Aslan]95-aslan 's command , [Peter]69-peter bestowed the Knighthood of [the Order of the Lion]1377-the order of the lion on [Caspian]87-caspian , and [Caspian]87-caspian , as soon as [he]87-caspian was knighted , [himself]87-caspian bestowed it on [Trufflehunter]119-trufflehunter and [Trumpkin]121-trumpkin and Reepicheep , and made [Doctor]96-doctor cornelius Cornelius [[his]87-caspian Lord Chancellor]1378-his lord chancellor , and confirmed the Bulgy Bear in [[his]87-caspian hereditary office of [Marshal of the Lists]1380-marshal of the lists]1379-his hereditary office of marshal of the lists . And there was great applause .

After this [the Telmarine soldiers]1366-the telmarine soldiers , firmly but without taunts or blows , were taken across [the ford]1293-the ford and [all]1463-all put under lock and key in [the town of Beruna]1268-the town of beruna and given beef and beer . [They]1366-the telmarine soldiers made a great fuss about wading [the river]363-the river , for [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers all hated and feared [running water]1386-running water just as much as [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers hated and feared woods and animals . But in the end the nuisance was over : and then the nicest part of that long day began .

[Lucy]72-lucy , sitting close to [Aslan]95-aslan and divinely comfortable , wondered what the trees were doing . At first [she]72-lucy thought [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers were merely dancing ; [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers were certainly going round slowly in two circles , one from left to right and the other from right to left . Then [she]72-lucy noticed that [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers kept throwing something down in the centre of both circles . Sometimes [she]72-lucy thought [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers were cutting off long strands of [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers hair ; at other times it looked as if [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers were breaking off bits of [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers fingers â€” but , if so , [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers had plenty of fingers to spare and it did not hurt [them]1366-the telmarine soldiers . But whatever [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers were throwing down , when it reached the ground , it became brushwood or dry sticks . Then [three or four of [the Red Dwarfs]1388-the red dwarfs]1387-three or four of the red dwarfs came forward with [their]1387-three or four of the red dwarfs tinder boxes and set light to the pile , which first crackled , and then blazed , and finally roared as a woodland bonfire on midsummer night ought to do . And [everyone]230-everyone sat down in a wide circle around it .

Then [Bacchus]173-bacchus and [Silenus]174-silenus and [the Maenads]1273-the maenads began a dance , far wilder than the dance of the trees ; not merely a dance for fun and beauty ( though it was that too ) but a magic dance of plenty , and where [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers hands touched , and where [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers feet fell , the feast came into existence â€” sides of roasted meat that filled the grove with delicious smell , and wheaten cakes and oaten cakes , honey and many - coloured sugars and cream as thick as porridge and as smooth as still water , peaches , nectarines , pomegranates , pears , grapes , strawberries , raspberries â€” pyramids and cataracts of fruit . Then , in great wooden cups and bowls and mazers , wreathed with ivy , came the wines ; dark , thick ones like syrups of mulberry juice , and clear red ones like red jellies liquefied , and yellow wines and green wines and yellowy - green and greenish - yellow .

But for [the tree people]1117-the tree people different fare was provided . When [Lucy]72-lucy saw [Clodsley Shovel]136-clodsley shovel the mole and [his]136-clodsley shovel the mole moles scuffling up the turf in various places ( which [Bacchus]173-bacchus had pointed out to [them]1366-the telmarine soldiers ) and realised that the trees were going to eat earth it gave [her]72-lucy rather a shudder . But when [she]72-lucy saw the earths that were actually brought to [them]1366-the telmarine soldiers [she]72-lucy felt quite different . [They]1366-the telmarine soldiers began with a rich brown loam that looked almost exactly like chocolate ; so like chocolate , in fact , that [Edmund]71-edmund tried a piece of it , but [he]71-edmund did not find it at all nice . When the rich loam had taken the edge off [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers hunger , the trees turned to an earth of the kind [you]1392-you see in [Somerset]64-somerset , which is almost pink . [They]1366-the telmarine soldiers said it was lighter and sweeter . At the cheese stage [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers had a chalky soil , and then went on to delicate confections of the finest gravels powdered with choice silver sand . [They]1366-the telmarine soldiers drank very little wine , and it made [the Hollies]201-the hollies very talkative : for the most part [they]1366-the telmarine soldiers quenched [their]1366-the telmarine soldiers thirst with deep draughts of mingled dew and rain , flavoured with forest flowers and the airy taste of the thinnest clouds .

Thus [Aslan]95-aslan feasted [the Narnians]88-the old narnians till long after the sunset had died away , and the stars had come out ; and the great fire , now hotter but less noisy , shone like a beacon in [the dark woods]1393-the dark woods , and [the frightened Telmarines]99-the telmarines saw it from far away and wondered what it might mean . The best thing of all about this feast was that there was no breaking up or going away , but as the talk grew quieter and slower , one after another would begin to nod and finally drop off to sleep with feet towards the fire and [good friends on either side]1394-good friends on either side , till at last there was silence all round the circle , and the chattering of water over stone at [the Fords of [Beruna]43-beruna]2103-the fords of beruna could be heard once more . But all night [Aslan]95-aslan and [the Moon]59-the moon gazed upon [each other]908-each other with joyful and unblinking eyes .

Next day [messengers]2000-messengers ( who were chiefly squirrels and birds ) were sent all over [the country]486-the country with a proclamation to the scattered Telmarines â€” including , of course , [the prisoners in [Beruna]43-beruna]1399-the prisoners in beruna . [They]2000-messengers were told that [Caspian]87-caspian was now [King]1598-king and that [Narnia]1-narnia would henceforth belong to [the Talking Beasts]124-talking beasts and [the Dwarfs and Dryads]94-dryads and [Fauns]99-the telmarines and other creatures quite as much as to [the men]1401-the men . [Any who chose to stay under the new conditions]1402-any who chose to stay under the new conditions might do so ; but for those who did not like the idea , [Aslan]95-aslan would provide [another home]1403-another home . [Anyone who wished to go there]1404-anyone who wished to go there must come to [Aslan]95-aslan and [the Kings]1749-the kings at [the Fords of [Beruna]43-beruna]2103-the fords of beruna by noon on the fifth day . [You]1407-you may imagine that this caused plenty of head - scratching among [the Telmarines]99-the telmarines . [Some of [them]99-the telmarines]1408-some of them , chiefly [the young ones]1409-the young ones , had , like [Caspian]87-caspian , heard stories of the Old Days and were delighted that [they]1408-some of them had come back . "[1416-some] [They]1411-these all were also suspicious . " [I]1411-these all do n't trust ['em]92-miraz , "[1411-these all] [they]1411-these all said . " Not with that awful Lion and all . At one end of [the glade]993-the glade [Aslan]95-aslan had caused to be set up two stakes of wood , higher than [a man]1682-a man 's head and about three feet apart . A third , and lighter , piece of wood was bound across them at the top uniting them , so that the whole thing looked like a doorway from nowhere into nowhere . In front of this stood [Aslan]95-aslan [himself]95-aslan with [Peter]69-peter on [his]95-aslan right and [Caspian]87-caspian on [his]87-caspian left . " [Men of [Telmar]11-telmar]2557-men of telmar , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan , " [you]2557-men of telmar who seek [a new land]2558-a new land , hear [my]95-aslan words . " [You]2557-men of telmar , [Sir Caspian]205-sir caspian , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan , " might have known that [you]2557-men of telmar could be [no true King of [Narnia]1-narnia]2563-no true king of narnia unless , like [the Kings of old]2236-the kings of old , [you]2557-men of telmar were [a son of [Adam]106-adam]1859-a son of adam and came from [the world of [[Adam]106-adam 's sons]2567-adam 's sons]2566-the world of adam 's sons . " And now , "[95-aslan] said [Aslan]95-aslan , " [[you]87-caspian men and women of [Telmar]11-telmar]2594-you men and women of telmar , will [you]87-caspian go back to [that island]2595-that island in [the world of men from which [[your]87-caspian fathers]2597-your fathers first came]2596-the world of men from which your fathers first came ? [The man , now a little pale]1440-the man , now a little pale , came forward . [Aslan]95-aslan and [[his]95-aslan court]1441-his court drew aside , leaving [him]1440-the man , now a little pale free access to the empty doorway of the stakes .

It was odd , and not very nice , to take off [their]1448-their royal clothes and to come back in [their]1448-their school things ( not very fresh now ) into that great assembly . [One or two of [the nastier Telmarines]99-the telmarines]1449-one or two of the nastier telmarines jeered . But [the other creatures]1450-the other creatures all cheered and rose up in honour of [Peter]69-peter , and [Susan]70-susan , and [Edmund]71-edmund and [Lucy]72-lucy . There were affectionate and ( on [Lucy]72-lucy 's part ) tearful farewells with all [[their]1448-their old friends]1451-their old friends â€” animal kisses , and hugs from [Bulgy Bears]128-the bulgy bears , and hands wrung by [Trumpkin]121-trumpkin , and a last tickly , whiskerish embrace with [Trufflehunter]119-trufflehunter . And of course [Caspian]87-caspian offered the Horn back to [Susan]70-susan and of course [Susan]70-susan told [him]87-caspian to keep it . And then , wonderfully and terribly , it was farewell to [Aslan]95-aslan [himself]95-aslan , and [Peter]69-peter took [his]69-peter place with [Susan]70-susan 's hands on [his]69-peter shoulders and [Edmund]71-edmund 's on [hers]70-susan and [Lucy]72-lucy 's on [his]69-peter and the first of [the Telmarine]103-telmarine 's on [Lucy]72-lucy 's , and so in a long line [they]1452-they moved forward to the Door . After that came a moment which is hard to describe , for [the children]254-the children seemed to be seeing three things at once . One was the mouth of a cave opening into the glaring green and blue of [an island in [the Pacific]68-the pacific , where [all the Telmarines]1455-all the telmarines would find [themselves]1455-all the telmarines the moment [they]1455-all the telmarines were through the Door]1454-an island in the pacific , where all the telmarines would find themselves the moment they were through the door . [The second]1456-the second was [a glade in [Narnia]1-narnia]1457-a glade in narnia , the faces of [Dwarfs]128-the bulgy bears and [Beasts]124-talking beasts , the deep eyes of [Aslan]95-aslan , and the white patches on [the Badger]120-the badger 's cheeks . But the third ( which rapidly swallowed up the other two ) was [the grey , gravelly surface of [a platform]1459-a platform in [a country station]1460-a country station]1458-the grey , gravelly surface of a platform in a country station , and a seat with luggage round [it]1461-it , where [they]1452-they were all sitting as if [they]1452-they had never moved from [it]1461-it â€” a little flat and dreary for a moment after all [they]1452-they had been through , but also , unexpectedly , nice in its own way , what with the familiar railway smell and the English sky and the summer term before [them]1452-they .

" Well ! "[69-peter] said [Peter]69-peter . " [We]1452-they have had a time . "[69-peter]
